name: Lake Superior
hint: Largest of the Great Lakes and the largest freshwater lake by surface area

name: Lake Michigan
hint: Only Great Lake entirely within the United States, bordered by Chicago

name: Lake Huron
hint: Second-largest of the Great Lakes, between Michigan and Ontario

name: Lake Erie
hint: Shallowest of the Great Lakes, connected to Niagara Falls

name: Lake Ontario
hint: Smallest of the Great Lakes, bordering Toronto

name: Great Bear Lake
hint: Largest lake entirely within Canada, in the Northwest Territories

name: Great Slave Lake
hint: Deepest lake in North America, in Canada's Northwest Territories

name: Lake Winnipeg
hint: Large lake in Manitoba, Canada, remnant of glacial Lake Agassiz

name: Lake Nicaragua
hint: Largest lake in Central America, one of the few with freshwater sharks

name: Lake Athabasca
hint: Large lake in Alberta and Saskatchewan, Canada, near the oil sands

name: Crater Lake
hint: Deepest lake in the US, formed in a volcanic caldera in Oregon

name: Lake Tahoe
hint: Stunning alpine lake on the California-Nevada border, famous for its crystal clarity

name: Lake Okeechobee
hint: Largest freshwater lake in Florida, feeds water into the Everglades

name: Great Salt Lake
hint: Largest saltwater lake in the Western Hemisphere, in Utah

name: Lake Chapala
hint: Largest freshwater lake in Mexico, near Guadalajara in Jalisco

name: Lake of the Woods
hint: Lake straddling the US-Canada border with over 14,000 islands

name: Lake Mead
hint: Largest reservoir in the US by capacity, formed by Hoover Dam on the Colorado River

name: Lake Powell
hint: Scenic reservoir on the Colorado River in Utah and Arizona with red rock canyons

name: Lake Managua
hint: Second-largest lake in Nicaragua, right next to the capital city

name: Lake Champlain
hint: Natural freshwater lake between New York and Vermont, site of key Revolutionary War battles
